tit.e: Shinaga no kuni no miyatsuko (regional governor in ancient Japan)
tit.cmt: (government post) government postには違いないと思いますが、これだと中央官僚のようにも聞こえるので、regional governor in ancient Japan（古代日本の地域の統括者）としました。
tit.e: Shinaga no kuni no miyatsuko (regional governor in ancient Japan)

sen.j: 師長国造（しながのくにのみやつこ・しながこくぞう)は相模国西部を支配した国造。
sen.e: Shinaganokuninomiyatsuko 師長国造 (also known as Shinagakokuzo) was kuninomiyatsuko ruled the west part of Sagami Province.
Shinaga no kuni no miyatsuko (師長国造), also known as Shinaga kokuzo, was a kuni no miyatsuko ruled the west part of Sagami Province.
Shinaga no kuni no miyatsuko (師長国造), also known as Shinaga kokuzo, was a kuni no miyatsuko ruled the west part of Sagami Province.
It is also Witten as 磯長国造.
It is also Witten as 磯長国造.
It is also Witten as 磯長国造.
Takekoronomikoto.
Takekoro no mikoto.
Takekoro no mikoto.
14th descendant from Amatsuhikonenomikoto.
The 14th descendant from Amatsuhikone no mikoto.
The 14th descendant from Amatsuhikone no mikoto.

sen.j: 成務朝にその子の意富鷲意弥命が師長国造に任じられたという。
sen.e: Oowashiominomikoto, a son of Takekoronomikoto, was appointed Shinaganokuninomiyatsuko during the reign of Emperor Seimu.
Oowashiomi no mikoto, a son of Takekoro no mikoto, was appointed Shinaganokuni no miyatsuko during the reign of Emperor Seimu.
Oowashiomi no mikoto, a son of Takekoro no mikoto, was appointed Shinaganokuni no miyatsuko during the reign of Emperor Seimu.

sen.j: 高市県主・茨城国造・三枝氏などと同系。
sen.e: He was descended from the same line as Takaichinoagatanushi, Ibarakinokuninomiyatsuko, and the Saegusa clan.
He was descended from the same line that includes Takaichi no agatanushi, Ibarakino kuni no miyatsuko, and the Saegusa clan.
He was descended from the same line that includes Takaichi no agatanushi, Ibarakino kuni no miyatsuko, and the Saegusa clan.
Unknwon.
Unknwon.
Unknwon.
Shinaga Go, Yorogi no Kori, Sagami Province.
Shinaga Go, Yorogi no Kori, Sagami Province,
sen.cmt: ,で繋いで次の文と一文になるようにしました。
sen.e: Shinaga Go, Yorogi no Kori, Sagami Province.

sen.j: 現在の神奈川県大磯町
sen.e: The present Oisomachi, Kanagawa Prefecture.
present Oisomachi, Kanagawa Prefecture.

sen.j: 同地域の古社としては川勾神社がある。
sen.e: The Kawawa-jinja Shrine is the old shrine in the area.
The area includes Kawasa-jinja Shrine, an very old shrine.
